Director of Community Planning at Asakura Robinson
Austin Texas United States
Summary
Andrew Knuppel serves as Director of Community Planning in
Asakura Robinson’s Austin studio He is excited about the power
of great design thoughtful policy and hightouch community
engagement to empower community action and facilitate
conversations around today’s pressing issues Having spent time
in the Midwest the Southeast the MidAtlantic and now Texas
he enjoys learning about and celebrating the histories defining
qualities and quirks of the places he works and lives in His planning
perspective is shaped by experiences working in local government
floodplain management and hazard mitigation
Prior to joining Asakura Robinson Andrew led a team of planners
with Texas A&M AgriLife Extension Service’s Texas Community
Watershed Partners in Houston conducting resiliencefocused
educational workshops and technical assistance projects and
supporting a network of disaster assessment and recovery
professionals across the state of Texas Before moving to Texas
Andrew worked in a variety of neighborhood planning and zoning
administration roles with Albemarle County Virginia
Andrew is a proud graduate of the University of Virginia holding an
undergraduate and graduate degrees in urban and environmental
planning In his free time Andrew enjoys exploring the local food
scene bike infrastructure and historic markers
Experience

platform

Supervise a technical assistance program and manage individual planning
assistance projects including zoning and subdivision ordinance writing GIS
analyses and hazard mitigation project identification exercises

partners

Eagle Scout
Virginia Chapter of the American
Planning Association Outstanding
Student AwardAndrew Knuppel, AICP, CFM
Director of Community Planning at Asakura Robinson
Austin, Texas, United States
Summary
Andrew Knuppel serves as Director of Community Planning in
Asakura Robinson’s Austin studio. He is excited about the power
of great design, thoughtful policy, and high-touch community
engagement to empower community action and facilitate
conversations around today’s pressing issues. Having spent time
in the Midwest, the Southeast, the Mid-Atlantic, and now Texas,
he enjoys learning about and celebrating the histories, defining
qualities, and quirks of the places he works and lives in. His planning
perspective is shaped by experiences working in local government,
floodplain management, and hazard mitigation.
Prior to joining Asakura Robinson, Andrew led a team of planners
with Texas A&M AgriLife Extension Service’s Texas Community
Watershed Partners in Houston, conducting resilience-focused
educational workshops and technical assistance projects and
supporting a network of disaster assessment and recovery
professionals across the state of Texas. Before moving to Texas,
Andrew worked in a variety of neighborhood planning and zoning
administration roles with Albemarle County, Virginia.
Andrew is a proud graduate of the University of Virginia, holding an
undergraduate and graduate degrees in urban and environmental
planning. In his free time, Andrew enjoys exploring the local food
scene, bike infrastructure, and historic markers.
Experience
Asakura Robinson
Senior Planner
November 2022 - Present  (1 year)
Austin, Texas, United States
  Page 1 of 4    
Texas Community Watershed Partners, Texas A&M AgriLife
Extension
2 years 1 month
Planning Program Manager
December 2021 - October 2022  (11 months)
Houston, Texas, United States
Planning Team Lead / Program Coordinator II
October 2020 - December 2021  (1 year 3 months)
Houston, Texas, United States
I lead the Texas Community Watershed Partners (TCWP) planning team in a
variety of flood hazard mitigation and community planning activities, including
applications of the CHARM (Community Health and Resource Management)
platform.
Oversee CHARM Resiliency Workshops in Texas communities, including
workshop organization, stakeholder outreach, and facilitation.
Supervise a technical assistance program and manage individual planning
assistance projects, including zoning and subdivision ordinance writing, GIS
analyses, and hazard mitigation project identification exercises.
Present information about TCWP programs and CHARM's applications for risk
assessment and community engagement in partnership with state and federal
partners.
Support program development and administration, including grant reporting
and compliance.
Provide support to other programs and projects as needed.
Albemarle County
3 years 10 months
Senior Neighborhood Planner
July 2020 - October 2020  (4 months)
Charlottesville, Virginia, United States
Neighborhood Planner
June 2018 - July 2020  (2 years 2 months)
Charlottesville, Virginia Area
Supported long-range planning efforts including the Rio29 Small Area Plan
(2018), Pantops Master Plan (2019), and Crozet Master Plan (2019-2020).
Provided staff support to the Crozet and 5th & Avon Community Advisory
Committees.
  Page 2 of 4    
Maintained geospatial and demographic datasets and conduct analysis in
support of planning efforts.
Managed performance reporting efforts including the Indicators of Progress
portion of the Planning Commission's Annual Report.
Launched a public-facing Development Dashboard tool to improve access to
information on active development projects.
Principal author of the 2019 Growth Management Report, which analyzed
development trends and the ability of the County's land use policies to
accommodate expected growth.
Zoning Planner
August 2017 - June 2018  (11 months)
Charlottesville, Virginia
Performed general zoning administration tasks, including development right
and parking determinations and letters of zoning compliance.
Reviewed personal wireless service facility, building, and legislative permit
applications for compliance with the County’s Zoning Ordinance.
Assisted in long-range planning efforts and preliminary scoping of a form-
based code zoning text amendment.
Initiated public-facing process improvements including redesigns of application
forms and pre-application conferences.
Planning Intern
January 2017 - August 2017  (8 months)
Charlottesville, Virginia Area
Researched performance metrics and prepared the Planning Commission's
2016 Annual Report, which was recognized by the American Planning
Association's Virginia Chapter at their 2018 conference.
Analyzed the County’s theoretical residential development capacity for future
land use, current zoning, and environmental constraints using Esri ArcGIS.
University of Virginia
Marketing Assistant / Graphic Designer
September 2016 - May 2017  (9 months)
Office of the Dean of Students
Designed and coordinated promotions, social media, and branding for the units
within the University’s Office of the Dean of Students. Updated & maintained
wayfinding materials for the Newcomb Hall student center.
The University of Virginia School of Architecture
Undergraduate Teaching Assistant
  Page 3 of 4    
August 2016 - December 2016  (5 months)
ARCH 1020 (Lessons In Making)
Served as a Teaching Assistant for the foundation design course for
undergraduates in the School of Architecture. 
Attended lectures and a weekly teaching seminar, co-led section workshops,
provided guidance to students, and graded projects.
CSX Transportation
Public Affairs - Strategic Infrastructure Intern
May 2015 - August 2015  (4 months)
Jacksonville, FL
Created a framework to assess the economic and social effects of
intermodal freight rail infrastructure development on local and regional levels.
Collaborated with internal and external stakeholders to identify case studies,
relevant metrics, and topics; produced a final presentation and economic
profiles for the areas and projects studied.
Reported to the Vice President of Strategic Infrastructure Initiatives.
Education
The University of Virginia School of Architecture
Master of Urban & Environmental Planning   · (2019 - 2020)
University of Virginia
Bachelor of Urban and Environmental Planning, Urban and Environmental
Planning; Economics (Architecture Minor)  · (2013 - 2017)
  Page 4 of 4
